intro.quote: The will to win is nothing without the will to prepare

roadToAutonomous.title: Road to Autonomous
roadToAutonomous.subtitle: Our simulation-first approach ensures every algorithm is battle-tested before deployment.

0.title: The Digital Twin (Gazebo)
0.description: We build and test every line of code in a simulated "Smart City" before it ever touches a wheel.

1.title: The Brain-Spine Handshake
1.description: Our custom Serial Protocol ensures the logic (Python) and the reflexes (C++) are perfectly synchronized.

2.title: Sim-to-Real Deployment
2.description: The moment the car arrives, we transfer our 90% tested software onto the physical Reely TC-04 chassis.

technicalGrid.title: Eyes, Spine, Brain
technicalGrid.subtitle: Our 15-member workforce operates like a precision F1 pit crew â€” each module specialized, all synchronized.

perception.name: Perception
perception.subtitle: The Eyes
perception.responsibility: Lane detection, Sign recognition, and IPM mapping.

embedded.name: Embedded
embedded.subtitle: The Spine
embedded.responsibility: PID Control, Motor PWM, and Serial Parsing.

integration.name: Integration

timeline.title: The 3-Month Journey
timeline.footer: Never give up. The car is coming.
timeline.footerDesc: A 1/10 scale educational prototype â€” initially flagged for additional customs classification, then transitioned to a specialized regulatory review under institutional tech frameworks. What followed was 63 days of persistent engagement, detailed technical submissions, and leveraging our university and industry network. From the GUC President to senior faculty to direct collaboration with the NTRA (National Telecommunications Regulatory Authority) â€” we navigated every official channel to bridge the gap between innovation and regulation.
timeline.footerBadge: Proud to be the only African team â€” also representing the Arab world and Middle East.

0.description: 15 detailed questions sent to BFMC team about hardware, funding, travel, and tech stack

1.description: All questions answered â€” green light to apply

2.description: Team RAVEN presents to Bosch jury

3.description: Selected as 1 of 78 teams (from 163 applicants) â€” only team from Africa

4.description: Official competition start â€” car shipped from Romania

5.description: Shipment held â€” misclassified as "vehicle spare parts"

6.description: Team explains it's a 1/10-scale educational prototype

7.description: Team visits Cairo Cargo Village with passports, supervisor letters, and IDs

8.description: Bill of Materials and Bosch documentation sent to NTRA

9.description: Technical discussion on Raspberry Pi integration (while fighting customs)

10.description: Notification that shipment was "cleared" â€” celebration was premature

11.description: Shipment flagged for specialized classification â€” requires additional institutional verification for remote-controlled prototypes

12.description: Team negotiates with DHL to hold shipment while pursuing independent appeal

13.description: Technical discussion on Nucleo integration (still no car)

14.description: Team leverages university and industry contacts to reach NTRA decision-makers directly - leaving no stone unturned, andabing DHL channels

15.description: DHL warns shipment may be returned if not resolved soon

16.description: GUC President and senior faculty provide official letters vouching for educational purpose

17.description: NTRA POC out of office â€” soft copy lost in system

18.description: Egypt implements new blockchain import system â€” adds complexity

19.description: Team submits all documents directly to NTRA in person

20.description: Decision rectified â€” clearance finally approved after 63 days

21.description: Legal documents returned to DHL Service Point

22.description: DHL confirms ready â€” standing by for delivery

ourJourney.title: Our Journey
ourJourney.subtitle: Behind The Scenes
ourJourney.description: The road to BFMC 2026 wasn't just code â€” it was customs documents, airport runs, and unwavering belief. We started documenting our journey months before even registering, because we knew we'd be part of this future, regardless of the odds.
ourJourney.note: * English captions for videos will be available soon.
ourJourney.story: When our car shipment faced unexpected regulatory delays during classification, we chose to double down on our Simulation-First strategy. The dates below prove it â€” we were building our codebase and documentation long before the hardware arrived. While navigating these complex procedures, our digital twin kept evolving. These hurdles didn't slow us down; they sharpened our technical resolve.
